message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has the right to refuse any medical treatment, including surgery, even if it may lead to serious consequences or death. Canceling the surgery is the most appropriate next step in management. Consulting the hospital ethics committee or obtaining consent from the patient's ex-husband is not necessary and may violate the patient's autonomy. Continuing with emergency life-saving surgery without the patient's consent is not ethically justifiable.
